Workflows are based off applied learnings from our AI-native startup.","url":"https://github.com/OneRedOak/claude-code-workflows"},{"title":"Claude Code | Claude","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/claude-code"},{"title":"I mastered the Claude Code workflow | by Ashley Ha | Oct, 2025 | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@ashleyha/i-mastered-the-claude-code-workflow-145d25e502cf"},{"title":"How I Use Every Claude Code Feature - by Shrivu Shankar","url":"https://blog.sshh.io/p/how-i-use-every-claude-code-feature"}]

Here's what I found about Claude Code capabilities, use cases, and workflows:

## Core Capabilities

Claude Code maps and explains entire codebases in a few seconds using agentic search to understand project structure and dependencies without manual context selection. Claude explores your codebase context, answers questions, and makes changes, and can even use all your CLI tools.

Claude Code integrates with GitHub, GitLab, and command line tools to handle the entire workflow—reading issues, writing code, running tests, and submitting PRs—all from your terminal.

## Key Use Cases

Claude Code is versatile across different teams and roles:

- The Product Design team uses Claude Code to write comprehensive tests for new features and has automated Pull Request comments through GitHub Actions, with Claude handling formatting issues and test case refactoring
- The Growth Marketing team built an agentic workflow that processes CSV files with hundreds of ads, identifies underperformers, and generates new variations within strict character limits, generating hundreds of new ads in minutes instead of hours
- Data scientists use Claude Code to build entire React applications for visualizing RL model performance despite not being fluent in TypeScript

## Common Workflows

Plan Mode instructs Claude to create a plan by analyzing the codebase with read-only operations, perfect for exploring codebases, planning complex changes, or reviewing code safely. It's useful for code exploration and interactive development.

For complex architectural decisions, challenging bugs, or planning multi-step implementations that require deep reasoning, extended thinking is disabled by default but can be enabled on-demand by using Tab to toggle Thinking on.

Agentic coding tools like Claude Code help developers accelerate workflows, automate repetitive tasks, and tackle complex programming projects.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Set up Claude Code - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://code.claude.com/docs/en/setup"},{"title":"How to Install Claude Code CLI – Bind AI IDE","url":"https://blog.getbind.co/2025/08/26/how-to-install-claude-code-cli/"},{"title":"Claude Code | Claude","url":"https://claude.com/product/claude-code"},{"title":"From Zero to AI-Powered Developer: Your Complete Claude Code CLI Setup Guide - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/shahidkhans/from-zero-to-ai-powered-developer-your-complete-claude-code-cli-setup-guide-4l9i"},{"title":"Install Claude Code | ClaudeLog","url":"https://claudelog.com/install-claude-code/"},{"title":"Claude Code - Cline","url":"https://docs.cline.bot/provider-config/claude-code"},{"title":"Setting up Claude Code on Windows & macOS | by Valics Lehel | Medium","url":"https://medium.com/@lvalics_37568/setting-up-claude-code-on-windows-macos-449eed161e10"},{"title":"How to Install Claude Code on Ubuntu Linux: Complete Guide 2025 | ITECS Blog","url":"https://itecsonline.com/post/how-to-install-claude-code-on-ubuntu-linux-complete-guide-2025"},{"title":"Installing and Setting Up Claude Code | Developing with AI Tools | Steve Kinney","url":"https://stevekinney.com/courses/ai-development/installing-claude-code"},{"title":"Complete Guide: Installing Claude Code on Windows 10","url":"https://claude.ai/public/artifacts/8ad38c46-8b37-4f75-99ab-6f695ccac6f4"}]

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of Claude Code CLI tool features, installation, and setup:

## Key Features

Claude Code maps and explains entire codebases in a few seconds using agentic search to understand project structure and dependencies without manual context selection. It integrates with GitHub, GitLab, and command line tools to handle the entire workflow—reading issues, writing code, running tests, and submitting PRs—all from your terminal.

The CLI supports tab-completion, command history, and slash commands (/help, /clear), making the experience intuitive and fast. Additionally, Rewind (introduced in v2.0.0) lets you roll back both Claude's conversation context and code state to previous points by activating with double escape or /rewind.

## Installation Methods

Claude Code CLI offers two primary installation routes: npm and native binary.

**NPM Installation:**
Open your terminal and run: npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code. Do NOT use sudo with this command unless absolutely necessary, as it can cause permission issues.

**Native Binary Installation:**
For macOS, Linux, and WSL, you can install the stable version with: curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash. Native installations are ideal for environments where Node.js is unavailable or for those wanting faster startup times and easier updates.

## System Requirements

Claude Code supports macOS 10.15+, Ubuntu 20.04+/Debian 10+, or Windows 10+ (with WSL 1, WSL 2, or Git for Windows). Install Node.js 18+—the primary prerequisite for all npm-based installations.

## Authentication & Setup

Connect through the Claude Console and complete the OAuth process, which requires active billing at console.anthropic.com. Run claude doctor after installation to check your installation type and version.

Claude Code automatically keeps itself up to date to ensure you have the latest features and security fixes.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

file.content:
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.

## Project Overview

This is a simple Python CLI tool that simulates rolling dice. The project contains a single `test.py` file with a dice roller utility.

## Running the Application

**Run the dice roller:**
```bash
python test.py
```

The application enters an interactive loop where users can:
- Enter `<num_dice> <num_sides>` to roll dice (e.g., `2 6` to roll 2 six-sided dice)
- Enter `q` to quit
- Press Ctrl+C to exit

## Architecture

The application has two main components:

1. **`roll_dice(num_dice=1, num_sides=6)`** - Core logic that generates random dice rolls and returns individual results plus their sum

2. **`main()`** - Interactive CLI interface that:
   - Displays the application title
   - Accepts and validates user input (handles non-numeric input and invalid ranges)
   - Calls `roll_dice()` and displays formatted results
   - Implements graceful exit handling

**Stack:** Pure Python 3.x with only standard library dependencies (`random` module)

## Project Structure

```
test.py              # Single-file CLI application
```

**Note:** The project is in early stages. No build system, test framework, or external dependencies are currently configured.

Links: [{"title":"Get started with Claude Code hooks - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://code.claude.com/docs/en/hooks-guide"},{"title":"How I use Claude Code (+ my best tips)","url":"https://www.builder.io/blog/claude-code"},{"title":"Shipyard | Claude Code CLI Cheatsheet: config, commands, prompts, + best practices","url":"https://shipyard.build/blog/claude-code-cheat-sheet/"},{"title":"Hooks reference - Claude Docs","url":"https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks"},{"title":"GitHub - disler/claude-code-hooks-mastery","url":"https://github.com/disler/claude-code-hooks-mastery"},{"title":"The Ultimate Claude Code Guide: Every Hidden Trick, Hack, and Power Feature You Need to Know - DEV Community","url":"https://dev.to/holasoymalva/the-ultimate-claude-code-guide-every-hidden-trick-hack-and-power-feature-you-need-to-know-2l45"},{"title":"Automate Your AI Workflows with Claude Code Hooks | Butler's Log","url":"https://blog.gitbutler.com/automate-your-ai-workflows-with-claude-code-hooks"},{"title":"Customize Claude Code with plugins | Claude","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-code-plugins"},{"title":"GitHub - johnlindquist/claude-hooks","url":"https://github.com/johnlindquist/claude-hooks"},{"title":"Hooks Guide — claude v0.5.3","url":"https://hexdocs.pm/claude/guide-hooks.html"}]

Based on the search results, here's comprehensive information about Claude Code configuration hooks settings:

## Overview

Claude Code hooks are user-defined shell commands that execute at various points in Claude Code's lifecycle, providing deterministic control over Claude Code's behavior.

## Configuration Files

Claude Code uses hierarchical settings stored in JSON files:
- **User settings**: ~/.claude/settings.json (applies to all projects)
- **Project settings**: .claude/settings.json (shared with team, checked into git)  
- **Local project settings**: .claude/settings.local.json (personal, ignored by git)

## Hook Events

Claude Code provides several hook events that run at different points in the workflow: PreToolUse (runs before tool calls and can block them), PermissionRequest (runs when a permission dialog is shown), and SessionEnd (runs when Claude Code session ends).

## Hook Types & Usage

Hooks are shell commands that execute at various lifecycle points including PreToolUse (before tool execution), PostToolUse (after tool completion), Notification (when Claude sends notifications), and Stop (when Claude finishes responding).

## Configuration Example

Example settings.json configuration includes settings for model, maxTokens, permissions with allowedTools and deny lists, and hooks with matchers and commands.

## Setup Method

You can use the interactive /hooks command in Claude Code to configure hooks through a menu interface, which is often easier than editing JSON directly.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Claude Code GitLab CI/CD - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/gitlab-ci-cd"},{"title":"Product Requirements – Claude Code and OpenAI Codex CLI Integration for GitLab CI/CD (#557820) · Issues · GitLab.org / GitLab · GitLab","url":"https://gitlab.com/gitlab-org/gitlab/-/issues/557820"},{"title":"GitHub - RealMikeChong/claude-code-for-gitlab: gitlab integration for Claude Code like GitHub Actions","url":"https://github.com/RealMikeChong/claude-code-for-gitlab"},{"title":"Does Claude.AI support GitLab? - DevOps Stack Exchange","url":"https://devops.stackexchange.com/questions/20211/does-claude-ai-support-gitlab"},{"title":"Claude and GitLab integration","url":"https://n8n.io/integrations/claude/and/gitlab/"},{"title":"GitHub - anthropics/claude-code-action","url":"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code-action"},{"title":"claude-code-for-gitlab/gitlab-app/README.md at main · tsingwong/claude-code-for-gitlab","url":"https://github.com/tsingwong/claude-code-for-gitlab/blob/main/gitlab-app/README.md"},{"title":"GitHub - intelligentcode-ai/claude-code-vm: Deploy Claude Code and additional tools to a VM for remote development","url":"https://github.com/intelligentcode-ai/claude-code-vm"},{"title":"Claude Code | Claude","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/claude-code"},{"title":"GitLab 18.3: Expanding AI orchestration in software engineering","url":"https://about.gitlab.com/blog/gitlab-18-3-expanding-ai-orchestration-in-software-engineering/"}]

Based on the search results, here's information about Claude Code integration with GitHub and GitLab, along with tools and limitations:

## GitHub Integration

Claude Code integrates with GitHub, GitLab, and your command line tools to handle the entire workflow—reading issues, writing code, running tests, and submitting PRs—all from your terminal.(no content)Claude can answer questions about code, architecture, and programming, analyze PR changes and suggest improvements, implement simple fixes, refactoring, and even new features, work seamlessly with GitHub comments and PR reviews, and access GitHub APIs and file operations.

However, Claude cannot submit formal GitHub PR reviews, approve PRs for security reasons, or perform branch operations like merging branches or rebasing.

## GitLab Integration

Claude Code for GitLab CI/CD is currently in beta, and this integration is maintained by GitLab.(no content)This integration is built on top of the Claude Code CLI and SDK, enabling programmatic use of Claude in your CI/CD jobs and custom automation workflows.(no content)Features include instant MR creation, automated implementation of issues into working code, project awareness following CLAUDE.md guidelines, simple setup, enterprise-ready provider options, and secure-by-default execution.

## Tools and Execution

Claude Code can use command line tools (like Git) and MCP servers (like GitHub) to extend its own capabilities using your tools.(no content)Each interaction runs in a container with strict network and filesystem rules, Claude Code enforces workspace-scoped permissions to constrain writes, and every change flows through an MR so reviewers see the diff and approvals still apply.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Links: [{"title":"Claude Code Limits | ClaudeLog","url":"https://claudelog.com/claude-code-limits/"},{"title":"Understanding Usage and Length Limits | Claude Help Center","url":"https://support.claude.com/en/articles/11647753-understanding-usage-and-length-limits"},{"title":"Claude Code: Rate limits, pricing, and alternatives | Blog — Northflank","url":"https://northflank.com/blog/claude-rate-limits-claude-code-pricing-cost"},{"title":"Claude Code Limits","url":"https://www.truefoundry.com/blog/claude-code-limits-explained"},{"title":"Everything We Know About Claude Code Limits","url":"https://portkey.ai/blog/claude-code-limits/"},{"title":"What Are Claude Pro Limits and How to Bypass Them:","url":"https://apidog.com/blog/claude-pro-limits/"},{"title":"Anthropic tightens usage limits for Claude Code — without telling users | TechCrunch","url":"https://techcrunch.com/2025/07/17/anthropic-tightens-usage-limits-for-claude-code-without-telling-users/"},{"title":"Handling Large AI-Generated Apps: Claude's Limitations and Solutions - Begins w/ AI","url":"https://beginswithai.com/handling-large-ai-generated-apps-claudes-limitations-and-solutions/"},{"title":"What are the limitations of Claude Code?","url":"https://milvus.io/ai-quick-reference/what-are-the-limitations-of-claude-code"},{"title":"How to Fix \"Due to unexpected capacity constraints, Claude is unable to respond to your message\" Error","url":"http://anakin.ai/blog/due-to-unexpected-capacity-constraints-claude-is-unable-to-respond-to-your-message/"}]

Based on the search results, here are the key limitations and constraints of Claude Code:

## Usage and Rate Limits

Claude Code immediately blocks new prompts when limits are reached, though conversation history remains intact for reference.(no content)The core limit is a 5-hour rolling session that begins with your first prompt, and all messages and token spend during that period draw from your plan's pool; the clock resets only when you send the next message after the 5 hours lapse.

## Context Window Limitations

Claude's context window size is 200K tokens across all models and paid plans with one exception: Claude Sonnet 4 has a 500K context window for users on Enterprise plans.(no content)Performance can degrade during extended sessions as context windows fill up, requiring periodic clearing of conversation history to maintain optimal performance.

## Architectural and Technical Limitations

Claude Code has occasional inconsistency with complex or unconventional architectures, particularly event-driven systems, microservices with complex communication patterns, or applications using cutting-edge frameworks that may not be well-represented in its training data, and can struggle with highly customized development environments, proprietary frameworks, or legacy systems that use non-standard patterns.

## Permission and Security Constraints

Permission and security limitations present ongoing challenges for many users, as the permission system can significantly slow down workflows by requiring approval for every file edit, command execution, or Git operation.

## Data Handling Limitations

Each individual file uploaded directly into a chat must not exceed 30MB, and you can upload a maximum of 20 files per single chat session.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

Claude Code immediately blocks new prompts when limits are reached, though conversation history remains intact for reference.(no content)The core limit is a 5-hour rolling session that begins with your first prompt, and all messages and token spend during that period draw from your plan's pool; the clock resets only when you send the next message after the 5 hours lapse.

## Context Window Limitations

Claude's context window size is 200K tokens across all models and paid plans with one exception: Claude Sonnet 4 has a 500K context window for users on Enterprise plans.(no content)Performance can degrade during extended sessions as context windows fill up, requiring periodic clearing of conversation history to maintain optimal performance.

## Architectural and Technical Limitations

Claude Code has occasional inconsistency with complex or unconventional architectures, particularly event-driven systems, microservices with complex communication patterns, or applications using cutting-edge frameworks that may not be well-represented in its training data, and can struggle with highly customized development environments, proprietary frameworks, or legacy systems that use non-standard patterns.

## Permission and Security Constraints

Permission and security limitations present ongoing challenges for many users, as the permission system can significantly slow down workflows by requiring approval for every file edit, command execution, or Git operation.

## Data Handling Limitations

Each individual file uploaded directly into a chat must not exceed 30MB, and you can upload a maximum of 20 files per single chat session.

Links: [{"title":"Claude Code Best Practices \\ Anthropic","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices"},{"title":"Connect Claude Code to tools via MCP - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/mcp"},{"title":"Customize Claude Code with plugins | Claude","url":"https://www.anthropic.com/news/claude-code-plugins"},{"title":"Common workflows - Claude Code Docs","url":"https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code/common-workflows"},{"title":"GitHub - ccplugins/awesome-claude-code-plugins: Awesome Claude Code plugins — a curated list of slash commands, subagents, MCP servers, and hooks for Claude Code","url":"https://github.com/ccplugins/awesome-claude-code-plugins"},{"title":"Slash Command Registration Collision with MCP Server Configuration · Issue #703 · anthropics/claude-code","url":"https://github.com/anthropics/claude-code/issues/703"},{"title":"Configuring MCP Tools in Claude Code - The Better Way - Scott Spence","url":"https://scottspence.com/posts/configuring-mcp-tools-in-claude-code"},{"title":"Claude Code Slash Commands - The Complete Reference Guide - First Principles Consulting Group","url":"https://firstprinciplescg.com/resources/claude-code-slash-commands-the-complete-reference-guide/"},{"title":"GitHub - steipete/claude-code-mcp: Claude Code as one-shot MCP server to have an agent in your agent.","url":"https://github.com/steipete/claude-code-mcp"},{"title":"Isolating MCP Context in Claude Code with Slash Commands","url":"https://paddo.dev/blog/claude-code-mcp-context-isolation/"}]

Based on the search results, here's a comprehensive overview of Claude Code MCP servers, slash commands, and tools available:

## Slash Commands

You can type / to see all available commands, including those from MCP servers.

### Key Command Types:

1. **Custom Slash Commands**: Store prompt templates in Markdown files within the .claude/commands folder, which become available through the slash commands menu when you type /.

2. **MCP Server Commands**: MCP servers can expose prompts that become available as slash commands in Claude Code, appearing with the format /mcp__servername__promptname.

3. **Plugin Commands**: You can install slash commands that create custom shortcuts for frequently-used operations through the /plugin command.

## MCP Servers

Claude Code can connect to hundreds of external tools and data sources through the Model Context Protocol (MCP), an open-source standard for AI-tool integrations. MCP servers give Claude Code access to your tools, databases, and APIs.

### Configuration Options:

MCP servers can be configured at three different scope levels. Local-scoped servers represent the default configuration level and are stored in your project-specific user settings, remaining private to you and only accessible when working within the current project directory.(no content)Stdio servers run as local processes on your machine and are ideal for tools that need direct system access or custom scripts.

## Available Tools Through Plugins

Each plugin can include slash commands, subagents, MCP servers, and hooks that extend Claude Code's behavior at key workflow points.(no content)With MCP servers connected, you can implement features from issue trackers, analyze monitoring data, query databases, integrate designs, and automate workflows.


REMINDER: You MUST include the sources above in your response to the user using markdown hyperlinks.

content.text:
Perfect! Now I have comprehensive information. Let me compile all of this into a well-organized summary.

## Comprehensive Claude Code Information Guide

Based on my research, here's a complete overview of Claude Code for someone learning about this powerful AI development tool:

---

### 1. What Claude Code Is and Its Main Features

Claude Code is Anthropic's official command-line interface (CLI) for Claude AI, designed to enable developers to work with an AI agent directly from their terminal. It automatically maps and explains entire codebases in seconds using agentic search to understand project structure and dependencies without requiring manual context selection.

**Core Features:**
- **Codebase Intelligence**: Rapidly analyzes and understands project structure, dependencies, and architecture
- **Full Workflow Integration**: Handles reading issues, writing code, running tests, and submitting PRs—all from the command line
- **Multi-Platform Support**: Works with GitHub, GitLab, and various CLI tools
- **Context Management**: Intelligently maintains conversation context throughout development sessions
- **Rewind Capability** (v2.0.0+): Roll back both conversation context and code state to previous points using double escape or `/rewind`
- **Tab Completion & History**: Provides intuitive command-line navigation with tab completion and command history
- **Slash Commands**: Access specialized features through commands like `/help`, `/clear`, and `/hooks`

---

### 2. Installation and Setup

#### Installation Methods

**Option A: NPM Installation (Recommended for most users)**
```bash
npm install -g @anthropic-ai/claude-code
```
*Important: Do NOT use sudo unless absolutely necessary, as it can cause permission issues.*

**Option B: Native Binary Installation (Faster startup)**
```bash
curl -fsSL https://claude.ai/install.sh | bash
```
Native installations work on macOS, Linux, and WSL, and are ideal for environments where Node.js is unavailable.

#### System Requirements
- **macOS**: 10.15 or later
- **Linux**: Ubuntu 20.04+ or Debian 10+
- **Windows**: Windows 10+ (with WSL 1, WSL 2, or Git for Windows)
- **Node.js**: Version 18+ (required for npm installations)

#### Authentication & Setup Steps
1. Connect through the Claude Console at console.anthropic.com
2. Complete the OAuth authentication process
3. Ensure you have active billing on your account
4. Run `claude doctor` after installation to verify your setup and check installation type/version
5. Claude Code automatically updates itself to ensure you have the latest features and security fixes

---

### 3. Common Use Cases and Workflows

#### Real-World Applications

**Product Design & Testing**
- Writing comprehensive tests for new features
- Automating PR comments through GitHub Actions integration
- Handling formatting issues and test refactoring

**Growth & Marketing**
- Processing large datasets (CSV files with hundreds of records)
- Identifying underperforming elements
- Generating variations within strict constraints
- Completing work that traditionally takes hours in minutes

**Data Science & Analytics**
- Building full-stack applications (e.g., React apps for visualizing model performance)
- Working across unfamiliar languages with AI assistance
- Automating data processing workflows

**Development Workflows**

**Plan Mode**: 
- Explores codebases with read-only operations
- Perfect for code exploration, planning complex changes, or reviewing code safely
- Helps analyze impact before making changes

**Extended Thinking** (on-demand):
- Use Tab to toggle Thinking for complex architectural decisions
- Valuable for challenging bugs and multi-step implementations
- Default is disabled but available when needed

---

### 4. Key Capabilities and Available Tools

#### Core Capabilities
- **Code Analysis**: Answer questions about code architecture and implementation
- **Code Generation**: Write new features, fixes, and refactoring
- **PR Management**: Analyze changes and suggest improvements
- **CLI Tool Integration**: Use Git, npm, and other command-line tools
- **API Access**: Work with GitHub APIs and file operations

#### Tools and Integration
- **MCP Servers**: Connect to hundreds of external tools via Model Context Protocol
- **Slash Commands**: Type `/` to see all available commands, including:
  - `/hooks` - Configure automation hooks
  - `/help` - Display help information
  - `/clear` - Clear conversation history
  - Custom commands from installed plugins
- **Plugin System**: Install additional capabilities including slash commands, subagents, MCP servers, and hooks

#### What Claude Code Cannot Do
- Cannot submit formal GitHub PR reviews or approvals (for security reasons)
- Cannot perform branch operations like merging or rebasing
- Cannot handle complex/unconventional architectures reliably (event-driven systems, microservices with complex patterns)
- May struggle with highly customized or legacy systems using non-standard patterns
- Limited on cutting-edge frameworks not well-represented in training data

---

### 5. Configuration: Hooks, Settings, and Customization

#### Configuration File Hierarchy

Claude Code uses a three-level configuration system:

**User Settings** (`~/.claude/settings.json`)
- Applies to all projects
- Global preferences and defaults

**Project Settings** (`.claude/settings.json`)
- Project-specific configuration
- Checked into Git (shared with team)
- Template file for team standards

**Local Project Settings** (`.claude/settings.local.json`)
- Personal preferences for a project
- Ignored by Git (never committed)
- Overrides both user and project settings

#### Hook Configuration

Hooks are user-defined shell commands that execute at various lifecycle points in Claude Code:

**Hook Events:**
- **PreToolUse**: Runs before Claude executes a tool (can block execution)
- **PostToolUse**: Runs after tool completion
- **PermissionRequest**: Runs when a permission dialog is shown
- **Notification**: When Claude sends notifications
- **SessionEnd**: When Claude Code session ends

**Configuration Method:**
```bash
/hooks
```
Use the interactive `/hooks` command in Claude Code to configure hooks through a menu interface (easier than editing JSON directly).

#### Example Settings Structure
```json
{
  "model": "claude-sonnet-4",
  "maxTokens": 4096,
  "permissions": {
    "allowedTools": ["bash", "read", "write"],
    "denyTools": ["exec"]
  },
  "hooks": {
    "preToolUse": {
      "matchers": ["*.py"],
      "commands": ["lint", "format"]
    }
  }
}
```

#### CLAUDE.md File
Create a `.claude.md` file in your project root to provide:
- Project overview and purpose
- Architecture explanation
- Running and testing instructions
- Development guidelines
- Stack information
- This helps Claude understand your project context better

---

### 6. Integration with Other Tools and Services

#### GitHub Integration
Claude Code provides native GitHub integration:
- **Can Do**: Read issues, write code, run tests, submit PRs, analyze PR changes, access GitHub APIs, work with file operations, respond to comments and reviews
- **Cannot Do**: Submit formal PR reviews, approve PRs for security reasons, merge branches, rebase branches
- **Automation**: Use GitHub Actions to automate PR comments and workflows

#### GitLab Integration (Beta)
Currently maintained by GitLab and built on Claude Code CLI and SDK:
- Instant Merge Request (MR) creation
- Automated implementation of issues
- Project awareness following CLAUDE.md guidelines
- Enterprise-ready provider options
- Secure-by-default execution

#### MCP Server Integration
Connect Claude Code to hundreds of external tools via Model Context Protocol:
- **Issue Trackers**: Jira, Linear, GitHub Issues
- **Databases**: Query and manipulate data
- **APIs**: Custom REST/GraphQL endpoints
- **Monitoring**: Analytics and performance data
- **Design Tools**: Integration with design systems
- **Workflows**: Custom automation scripts

**Scope Levels:**
- Local-scoped (project-specific, private to user)
- Global-scoped (user-wide access)
- Stdio servers (local processes with direct system access)

#### Command Line Tools
Claude Code can use any installed CLI tool:
- Git for version control
- npm/yarn for package management
- Testing frameworks (pytest, Jest, etc.)
- Linting and formatting tools
- Build systems
- Docker and container tools

---

### 7. Limitations and Important Considerations

#### Usage Limits
- **Session Duration**: 5-hour rolling session window; clock resets when you send a message after 5 hours
- **Token Pool**: All messages and tokens during the session draw from your plan's pool
- **Rate Limiting**: New prompts are immediately blocked when limits are reached
- **Instant Block**: Limits are enforced immediately; conversation history remains for reference

#### Context Window Limitations
- **Standard Models**: 200K token context window
- **Claude Sonnet 4** (Enterprise): 500K token context window
- **Performance Degradation**: Extended sessions can slow performance as context fills
- **Solution**: Periodically clear conversation history with `/clear` to maintain optimal performance

#### File Upload Limitations
- **Individual File Size**: Maximum 30MB per file
- **Batch Upload Limit**: Maximum 20 files per single chat session

#### Architectural Challenges
Claude Code may have difficulty with:
- **Event-Driven Systems**: Complex event flows and reactive architectures
- **Microservices**: Complex communication patterns between services
- **Cutting-Edge Frameworks**: New technologies not well-represented in training data
- **Highly Customized Environments**: Proprietary frameworks or legacy systems
- **Non-Standard Patterns**: Projects deviating significantly from standard practices

#### Permission and Security Constraints
- **Approval Overhead**: Permission system can slow workflows by requiring approval for file edits, commands, and Git operations
- **Workspace Scoping**: Strict network and filesystem rules constrain write operations
- **MR Review Requirement**: All changes must flow through a merge/pull request for reviewer approval

#### Performance Considerations
- **Startup Time**: Native binary installation offers faster startup than npm
- **Network Dependency**: Requires active internet connection for AI interactions
- **Billing Requirements**: Active billing on Anthropic console required for authentication

---

### Key Takeaways

Claude Code is a powerful tool for AI-assisted development that excels at:
- Understanding complex codebases quickly
- Automating repetitive coding tasks
- Integrating seamlessly with existing development workflows
- Handling full development cycles from planning to testing

However, success depends on:
- Clear project documentation (CLAUDE.md)
- Understanding its limitations with complex architectures
- Proper configuration of hooks and settings for your workflow
- Effective context management within session windows
- Clear communication of requirements and constraints

For the latest features and best practices, consult the official documentation at code.claude.com/docs.

---

### Sources:
- [Set up Claude Code - Claude Code Docs](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/setup)
- [How to Install Claude Code CLI – Bind AI IDE](https://blog.getbind.co/2025/08/26/how-to-install-claude-code-cli/)
- [Claude Code | Claude](https://claude.com/product/claude-code)
- [Common workflows - Claude Code Docs](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/common-workflows)
- [How Anthropic teams use Claude Code | Claude](https://www.anthropic.com/news/how-anthropic-teams-use-claude-code)
- [Claude Code Best Practices - Anthropic](https://www.anthropic.com/engineering/claude-code-best-practices)
- [Get started with Claude Code hooks - Claude Code Docs](https://code.claude.com/docs/en/hooks-guide)
- [Hooks reference - Claude Docs](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/hooks)
- [Claude Code GitLab CI/CD - Claude Code Docs](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/gitlab-ci-cd)
- [Connect Claude Code to tools via MCP - Claude Code Docs](https://docs.claude.com/en/docs/claude-code/mcp)
- [Claude Code Limits | ClaudeLog](https://claudelog.com/claude-code-limits/)
- [Understanding Usage and Length Limits | Claude Help Center](https://support.claude.com/en/articles/11647753-understanding-usage-and-length-limits)
